comment: CSE 1321/L is easy if you can teach yourself. Take the class online if you can, or take KSU's CCSE CPL departmental challenge exam if you are a SWE/GD major and feel confident with the material already so you can skip it.

Ive had experience with coding so overall this class was fairly easy if you study the quizzes.

Although, I was given a 75% group participation when I did the entire thing myself. No idea how that works

Goes through slides very slowly. Try someone else or take it online unless you need a slower pace. Might fall behind on content needed for the labs sometimes. Attendance dropped but I kept going for some reason. Quiz every unit (no lockdown), 1 midterm & final (lockdown + camera), pygame project (group of 4-5). Midterm/final reuses quiz questions.

Professor's syllabus was a lie. Got zero feedback or grades on project milestones throughout the semester. This is a project based class. He got too lazy to grade, so he ended up making our final presentation the grade for everything. Not cool
Do not take his class. If you have to, consider waiting another semester for another professor.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Doesn't really teach. Very Quiet. Reads off every slide making class very boring and not interactive at all. Lectures seemed pointless and a waste of time. Get ready to self-teach 90% of material.

Quizzes are open note. Tests, I would specifically make sure you read questions twice before answering because they are nitpicky. Lectures are boring as he reads from the slides. If you can learn well you could probably easily get an A for the class, you won't have the best time though.

I had no prior experience in coding, but this class doable. The only hard thing was he read off of slides and his heavy accent made it really hard to follow. Group project are really easy as long as everyone do their parts. Finals and midterm are literally the weekly quizzes for most of the questions.

This is a very hard class because the project is waaaaay to difficult for a last-semester class. I was taking 6 classes with the senior project. and this was more work than that. I wish it was a little lighter. Team effort matters a ton. Prof is very kind and smart, I would ask him a lot of questions and advice.

very boring, just reads off powerpoint slides. tutors have honestly taught me better than the lectures. if you don't go to a lecture you can just listen to the recordings and take notes on the slides.

Sit in the front if you want an A. I have an A so far. He just goes over lectures slides every time. Quizes every week. Midterm is just made up of quiz questions. Most of my classmates that are new to programming don't like him. If you have no prior programming experience don't take this class. I have prior coding experience so class isnt bad.

Prof. Mamo is very intelligent and knowledgeable on programming. He always asks "thinking questions" to help students understand how to apply the concept. Weekly quizzes are open note, review over ALL the quizzes before taking a test or exam and you'll get a really good grade. I have an A in the class so far.

Truthfully just find a better professor. He goes over the slides all class; anyone can do that and isn't very understandable due to his accent. If there is any other professor choose them and save yourself.
pretty alright, his class was not that bad, but the lab and tutoring sessions provided a better understanding of the material than his lectures.

I would not recommend this professor for an online class. He doesn't have good communication, and he doesn't want to work with his students' availability if it doesn't match up with his limited availability. He only bent when another student got the Dean of the department involved.

Mostly just reads off of powerpoints slides, and the class really only teaches you coding content and not *how* to code, so be aware of that for your labs. He asks good questions, but spends too much time on example code. Lectures are often quite boring as well.
Honestly, I found his class to be pretty easy. As long as you show up to lectures and take notes you will be fine. Stay on top of your work and stay aware of due dates.

Professor absolutely refuses to accept any late work regardless if it was my fault or not and then mimicked the same policy to the chair and program coordinator.

Gradescope uploaded BLANK files, and due to no autograder being configured I didn't realize until after grades were returned and I got a zero for the assignment, and he's refusing the lab

He's very sassy.

I wish I took a different professor for this course.

It definitely felt like I was teaching myself programming totally useless to attend classes. I recommend definitely going to tutoring just for the bonus points it will save you I promise terrible communication, no rounding beware of this professor KSU provides all the material online so it really is useless to go to class especially his.
I took the online CSE 1321 course, and it was pretty straight forward. Just 8  quizzes 2 test and a final exam. Just make sure to study the quizzes as well for the exams.

As long as you attend the lecture and do the labs every week, you'll make a good grade in the class.

Professor Mamo provided helpful feedback and inspired us to do more than what was necessary.
He is a good professor. He wants you to improve and really brings a lot of real life context into his lectures. He makes you interested to learn and excited for your future.

Professor Mamo might seem a little rough around the edges at first, but he really just wants everyone to succeed, and will work with you as long as you want (and ask for) help. Class is heavily lecture focused, but it is very easy if you don't skip class and actively participate in lectures, and even study just a little bit throughout the week.

This professor is ridiculous. I needed literally .10 more to get a B and go on to the second class after taking this a second time. But no. He refused to even do that for me. Absolutely no reason to take this class and if you do just know that a couple bad grades could make you fail the whole course as I had 100s on 90% of the assignments
As long as you attend lectures, you will get a great grade. He will talk about key points before every exam.

The teacher was not very accessible. If it is your first time coding this class may be difficult for you but if you turn in all the assignments youll get a good grade. He drops 2 assignments at the end of the course.

This was by far the worst experience I have ever had in a class. This professor is an actual joke. I still haven't received a single grade even though FINAL grades are due tomorrow. The professor doesn't respond to emails. He is arrogant. His critique of your project will constantly contradict the written requirements. Good luck. You need it.

This is by far the worst class I have ever taken. The only teaching that occurs is during the first few weeks of class and is on accounting. The remainder of the course is taken up by a very difficult group project. Mamo refuses to offer any help other than critiquing your work and expects you to neglect your other classes and sleep. Ridiculous!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: The only thing you can count on him doing is regurgitating lectures. Offers no insight throughout the class and continues to read word for word on the slides provided by the department or provide half baked explanations. Frequently expressed his disregard for his students, though never responding to emails or with his attitude throughout class.

One word - Disaster. Run if you see this professor's name. If you see TBA for professor's name at the time of registration, they will eventually assign this professor for that course. Department doesn't seem to care about students' numerous complaints about this professor.

Mamo has a great idea going with the App Domain class. However, he focuses too much lecture time on the domain knowledge and too little time on how to develop a functional web application, which is actually what your grade depends upon. If you need help on the mechanics of the project, don't count on him for anything except functionality comments.

The guy is a complete mess, I don't know what experience he says he has in the industry, he doesn't even know about GitHub. The tests he gives don't matter, all he wants is the project. Doesn't teach anything in class, if you ask him a question about any new technology for example Angular, React, he just doesn't answer and moves on to useless stuff

The class should be called Accounting Principals, not Application Domain. The professor taught me absolutely nothing about application domains. We had one test which was entirely about accounting and was never graded. The grade for the course comes from a group project where you create an accounting software from scratch with no guidance on how.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Worst online professor I have ever had. Posted materials then removed everything, reposted but this time posted two versions of the class, no clear deadlines, no response to emails, nothing for weeks. Retaliated when reported to superiors. Finally gave schedule for projects, then would randomly inserted extra work with only 3-5 days to complete.

Dr. Mamo brings over 20 years of real world experience in Software engineering. You will learn a lot from his class. He always explains things with real world examples and experiences, which is awesome. He will provide you with insight of the software and IT industry, which you will not get from any other professor. Overall an awesome professor.

He is not bad nor he is not good. I pass this class with a B. He has accent but you can understand him. He makes jokes all the time. He is willing to help you out and he is willing to work with you. He does give out homework but grade it slow.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Mamo is a good professor; easy going guy. There's a major group project and discussion posts & one midterm which wasn't too bad. Doesn't really respond to his emails in a timely manner which is pretty agitating at times. I think this is his first time teaching Software Requirements though, so there's room for improvement here and there.

Mamo was assigned this class on the first day of classes with no prior prep. However, 10 weeks into the semester, the documents he posts have conflicting information, deadlines are not clear, and he doesnt address the class unless the entire class emails him asking for help. Avoid.
